Dialogue.Stage Direction: In a wicker and wood hall, a scantily leather-clad tribe of people meet to decide the fate of a young woman.

Dialogue.Line: You are the leader, Andor. It is for you to decide. But there can be but one punishment for such a heresy. Banishment.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The leader is sitting on a throne which looks like it has some high-tech origin.

Dialogue.Line: What say you, Sole?
(old man) You know you should not ask.
Then it is agreed. You must be sent beyond.
No! She's young, she spoke rashly.
Don't beg, Tomas. What I said was the truth.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The tribal shaman, with bald head and metal badge of office around his neck, steps forward.

Dialogue.Line: What she said profaned the holy purpose of the tribe of Sevateem.
Holy purpose? To die in another useless attack?
The great god Xoanon demands that she be cast out. He told me this.
Liar! There is no Xoanon.
Blasphemy!
Leela, will you take the test of the Horda?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela shakes her head.

Dialogue.Line: Will any take it for her?
I will.
No. You'll be killed too.
Be silent, daughter. You have said enough.
Test him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two bare-chested young men take Sole away.

Dialogue.Line: Andor, please, call them back. What I said, I was wrong. Forgive me, please. Neeva, greatest shaman, Speaker of Law, forgive me, please.
Be silent, girl. Your father was a warrior. Do not shame him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Screams come from off camera. Leela and Tomas both use their right hands to touch their neck, left shoulder and left hip as a form of blessing.

Dialogue.Line: Outcast of the tribe of Sevateem, be gone from us.
Spawn of the evil one, return to your master.
You have until sunrise. If you are still within the boundary then, you must be thrown to the Horda.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela leaves. The tribal men gather in groups to mutter amongst themselves, all except Tomas.

Animals call in the night, and a cybermat shaped thing with a small forked tail slithers along the sandy ground as the Tardis materialises amongst dead looking trees. The Doctor steps out, looks around, and speaks to the camera.

Dialogue.Line: I think this is not Hyde Park. Could be a nexial discontinuity. Must remember to overhaul those tracers. Put a knot in my hanky.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: His hanky already has a knot in it.

Dialogue.Line: I wonder what that was for. Little look round, Doctor? Why not.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Men with crossbows are stalking Leela through what passes for a forest. She knows this, and hides behind the fattest tree trunk she can find to get her own crossbow loaded with a dart. One of the hunters comes into view, and she fires. He falls. She stoops to reload and another hunter takes aim at her, only to get a dart in the shoulder blade before he can do so.

Dialogue.Line: Tomas. What are you doing here?
I've come to take you back.
You can't.
I saw Neeva send them. We can tell the council.
It won't make any difference. Not now.
You can't cross the boundary.
They didn't leave me much choice.
There are phantoms in the beyond.
Feast fire stories.
Well, there's something there.
Then I'll face it. I can take care of myself.
I'll go with you.
No. Go back to the tribe. I'm going now. Goodbye, Tomas. Beware of the devious Calib. One day he'll get so cunning even he won't know what he's planned.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Elsewhere, the Doctor is whistling 'Colonel Bogey' as he explores. Something large growls nearby. Leela hears it too, and is afraid. She starts to run as lianas move behind her, until she trips and falls at the Doctor's feet.

Dialogue.Line: Hello. Hello, did I startle you? Don't be afraid. I won't hurt you.
The Evil One.
Well, nobody's perfect, but that's overstating it a little. I'm the Doctor. What's your name?
Leela.
Leela. A nice name, Leela. I never met anyone called Leela. Would you like a jelly baby?
It's true, then. They say the Evil One eats babies.
You mustn't believe all they say. No, these are sweets. They're rather good. Go on, have one.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He holds out the paper bag to her.

Dialogue.Line: Go on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela takes a black jelly baby and sniffs it, then tears it in half to eat.

Dialogue.Line: Leela. Leela, either you've got four friends with very bad colds, or we're in danger. Which is it?
They're your creatures.
They are? I wonder if they know that. What are they like?
They can't be seen.
Ah.
They are phantoms.
Invisible. We've got a chance.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes what looks like a wind-up alarm clock from his pocket, except it only has the numbers 0 to 4 on it, anticlockwise.

Dialogue.Line: A magic talisman?
No, it's a clockwork egg timer. To our friends, whatever they are, the visible spectrum is irrelevant. They're blind. Crudely speaking, they home in on vibrations.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor winds it up and puts it on a large stone nearby. Leela picks up her crossbow.

Dialogue.Line: Now, Leela
They've gone.

Shush, shush, shush. I want you to do exactly as I say. You and I are going to walk away from here very slowly and very quietly. And no matter what happens, you mustn't cry out or make any sudden move. And above all, you mustn't run until I tell you. Is that clear?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela nods.

Dialogue.Line: Good. Now come on. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes Leela's hand and they carefully walk away.

Dialogue.Line: Freeze.
What?
Shush!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Big footprints appear in the sand.

Dialogue.Line: Now tread carefully.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor trips and falls flat on his face in front of the footprints. The egg timer goes off.

Dialogue.Line: Saved by the bell. Come on. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stones near the egg timer go flying in all directions, then the timer is squished flat.

Dialogue.Line: Calib! Calib, wait. I don't know if you're interested, but Neeva sent two men in secret to try and kill Leela.
I'm interested, Tomas.
They failed.
Neeva is making mistakes.
You must call a council meeting and tell them.
Tell them what?
That he broke the law.
Oh, don't be naive, Tomas. Even if the council believed it, don't you think Neeva would have an answer? He's the Speaker of Law.
There must be something we can do?
There is. You know he's promised us victory in the raid.
What more would you expect?
No, he's promised us! He says Xoanon has told him we will win. You see what that means?
That he will look a fool if we don't.
More than that. He's going to look like the charlatan he is. Then we can move against him and that puppet, Andor.
Many men are going to die, Calib. We should stop the raid!
Leela tried.
And she's probably dead.
Stop, we're safe now. We can rest. The creatures won't cross the boundary.
How can you be sure?
They never have. You should know that.
I keep on telling you, I'm not the Evil One. Who was it saved your life?
You did.
Yes, thank you. Never cross the boundary? You know something? I'm sure those creatures don't stay on their side of the boundary out of a sense of fair play. There must be a fence of some kind.
A fence?
Yes, a fence.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: This room is directly behind the meeting hall. Neeva is relaxing on what looks suspiciously like an acceleration couch when Tom Baker calls his name.

Dialogue.Line: Neeva! Neeva!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Neeva kneels down.

Dialogue.Line: Speak, lord, for your servant hears.
The girl Leela has returned across the boundary. You have failed.
O great god Xoanon, I have faithfully done all that you commanded of me.
You crawling thing, do you presume to argue?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Neeva grovels.

Dialogue.Line: No, master. Forgive me.
She and the one who is with her must be destroyed. See that it is done.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor removes a blue-green rosette plant to reveal a piece of equipment half buried in the sand.

Dialogue.Line: Got it. Low intensity sonic disrupter set in a hundred and eighty degree spread. Simple but effective.
Does that keep away the phantoms?
Yes. It gives them a nasty headache if they go too close. They're probably set at intervals along the whole boundary.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He puts the plant back.

Dialogue.Line: The technology's quite advanced, so you didn't put them there.
Xoanon!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela blesses herself again.

Dialogue.Line: Xoanon? What's those?
He's worshiped by the tribe.
What, he's a god?
Yes. I was cast out for speaking against him.
Really.
It's said he's held captive.
By whom?
By the Evil One and his followers, the Tesh. Maybe there is a holy purpose. I don't know what to believe anymore.
Well, that sounds healthy anyway, Leela. Never be certain of anything. It's a sign of weakness. Now, where's this Xoanon held?
Within the Black Wall, wherein lies Paradise.
Is that just religious gobbledygook, or is that an actual place?
There is a Wall.
Is there. Will you show me?
Why has the game disappeared from the land? Where is the love of Xoanon for his people? Where is your magic?
Xoanon knows there are those amongst the people who do not wish to fight.
And so he starves us?
No, but how can he bless people who do not love him? There will be food for those who brave the Wall in his name.
Men do not fight well on empty stomachs!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tomas enters.

Dialogue.Line: The Wall will be at its weakest soon. Soon you can call the warriors and I will speak the litany.
Do not delay too long.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Neeva leaves by the back door. Andor thumps the arm of his 'throne' in anger.

Dialogue.Line: Well, Tomas?
There's something I wish to say.
Yes?
You should know that I agreed with Leela about the attack. It's madness. Many of us will die and we shall achieve nothing.
Nevertheless, we shall attack.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Neeva is eavesdropping.

Dialogue.Line: It is the will of Xoanon.
We only have Neeva's word for that.
We must have faith.
In the word of an assassin? He sent men to try and kill Leela, but perhaps you already knew that.
Watch your tongue, boy! And don't let me hear you speak against the attack again. We shall strive to free Xoanon from the Tesh, and we will do it together, as one people.
Yes, Andor.
Come, Tomas

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Andor and Tomas leave by the front door, as Neeva watches from the back door.
Night is falling again.

Dialogue.Line: Shush.
What is it?
I thought I heard something.
What?
Into cover, quick.
I don't. Leela? Leela, where are you?
Over here.
What? This is no time to be playing games.
I don't understand.
You don't understand? If they're preparing for a battle, they're hardly likely to send men on patrol on the off-chance that you might come back.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two crossbow bolts thud into the tree trunk directly in front of the Doctor. Leela is hiding behind it.

Dialogue.Line: On the other hand, I could be wrong about that. [OC]: Stand still!
Oh, absolutely. (sotto) Keep down, Leela, and get moving.
(sotto) I can't leave you. They'll kill you.
(sotto): Go away. (loud) That was either very good shooting or very bad. Either way, I wouldn't dream of moving.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Three men with crossbows come into view.

Dialogue.Line: Who are you?
I'm the Doctor. Who are you and why are you shooting at me?
Where is Leela?
Who?
Spread out. She must be here somewhere.
Look, would you mind if I turned round? I feel a bit silly talking to this tree.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor turns and walks forward, and the warrior blesses himself.

Dialogue.Line: The Evil One.
Oh dear, you too. Well then, tread softly, gentlemen, or I'll turn you into toads.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela starts to creep away.

Dialogue.Line: That gesture you did. Yes, that's the one. It's presumably to ward off evil. It's interesting because it's also the sequence for checking the seals on a Starfall Seven spacesuit. And what makes that particularly interesting is that you don't know what a Starfall Seven spacesuit is, do you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor holds a jelly baby under the nose of the red-haired warrior.

Dialogue.Line: Now drop your weapons, or I'll kill him with this deadly jelly baby.
Kill him, then.
What?
Kill him, then.
I don't take orders from anyone.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor eats the jelly baby.

Dialogue.Line: Take me to your leader.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The hall is already full when Andor enters and goes to his 'throne'. Neeva is parading a piece of tech with four blue cylinders along the top and two pipes coming out of the sides, whilst silently muttering his incantations.

Dialogue.Line: Bring it forth.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is escorted in. He is blindfolded with his own scarf, and his hands are tied behind his back. His captor unwraps the scarf from his face.

Dialogue.Line: Good evening. I think you're going to be very happy I came here tonight.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela is using a very large hunting knife to cut through the fabric that makes up the back wall of Neeva's hut. She climbs through. In the hall, we see Neeva waving his tech up and down the Doctor's body like a Native American Medicine man.

Dialogue.Line: Hi ya, hi ya.
I'd be careful of that if I were you. It's an ultrabeam accelerator.
See how it fears the sacred relics of Xoanon.
If there happens to be a charge in there, you could transform this whole village into a smoky hole in the ground.
Hear how it threatens us.
Yes, well, look, if you'll just untie my hands, I think I have an idea of what's going on. I may be able to help.
Hear how it squirms for release. Hey, hi ya. Ah, it cannot deceive us.
Oh no, I can see you're a person of very superior intellect. (to Andor) Are you the leader of this tribe, or his he?
Bring it closer.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is pushed forward.

Dialogue.Line: Will you release our god Xoanon?
Well, gladly, if I was holding him prisoner, but I'm not.
Then you must be destroyed, that we may release him.
Eh?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Andor brings his knife up to the Doctor's throat.

Dialogue.Line: Wait, Andor. Call the warriors together and I will speak the litany. Then it shall be destroyed before them and they will know that victory is ours.
Very well.
I will prepare myself.
Guard, give the signal.
Don't hurry on my account.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela hides as Neeva enters his hut. Outside, someone is striking gong made of a large square of metal, labelled Survey Team 6.

Dialogue.Line: I cannot believe it.
Andor, listen to me.
No. No!
Andor, please listen to me. I am not the Evil One. I am a traveller, that's all. Your tribe has obviously been visited by travellers before.
Before? But that is impossible.

They're space travellers, Andor. Men from another world. The whole place is littered with their equipment, their weapons and tools. Your legend of a captive god is obviously related to them in some way.
Guard it well.
Andor, please think about what
Its words are evil.
Andor.
Do not listen to him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Andor leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Andor, killing me isn't going to help you. It isn't going to do me much good either, is it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela is listening as Neeva prays, having robed himself with the remains of spacesuit. The helmet hangs down his back.

Dialogue.Line: Let the tribe of the Sevateem partake of your strength, Xoanon, that they may inherit your kingdom. Hear thy servant Neeva. Hear the shaman of the Sevateem. Hear my prayer.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is sitting in the stalls when Neeva enters in his regalia and goes to speak to a warrior.

Dialogue.Line: Lugo, when I reach the end of the litany, you know what to do.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela watches from the back door.
The warriors kneel around Neeva. The Doctor listens to the litany.

Dialogue.Line: Our fathers of the tribe of Sevateem were sent forth by God to seek Paradise.
And still we seek.
They searched and found it not. While they searched, the tribe of Tesh.
Cursed be the cowards of Tesh.
Remained at the place of land, betrayed our fathers.
Death to the betrayers of Tesh.
Death to the betrayers of Tesh.
Made a pact with the Evil One, and God turned his face from us.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela sneaks in and stabs Lugo in the back. He slumps to his knees.

Dialogue.Line: And the Evil One raised the Tower of Immolo and the Black Wall and gave them to the tribe of Tesh.
How did you do that?
Janis thorn. It paralyses, then kills. There's no cure.
Cursed be the tribe of Tesh.
What?
It was necessary.
Cursed be the tribe of Tesh.
Come on.
The tribe of Tesh stand between the sons of the tribe of Sevateem and Xoanon, god of their fathers. We must kill the servants of the Evil One.
Kill the Tesh. Kill the Tesh!
Kill the Tesh!
No, listen. Listen.
We haven't got time to listen.
Kill the Tesh!
They're coming to the bit about killing the Evil One, and that's you! Have you forgotten?
Now is the time when the Sevateem shall rise in their wrath.
Do you know this litany?
Of course. We're taught it as children.
In the name of Xoanon.
Good. Then let's go, and don't dawdle.
And kill their master, the Evil One!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two warriors enter.

Dialogue.Line: Destroy it. Destroy it! Destroy it!
It's escaped! The Evil One's escaped!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela shows the Doctor the way out through Neeva's back wall, which means that his room is actually a back room to the meeting hall, and not separate.

Dialogue.Line: Find it! Find it! Search everywhere!
Here! It's here!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor gets out just in time. The warrior sticks his head through the fabric and Leela stabs him with a thorn. She spreads his arms out as they stiffen, so he cannot be pulled back into the room.

Dialogue.Line: That wasn't necessary. Who licensed you to slaughter people? No more Janis thorns, you understand? Ever.
He must be recaptured. It is imperative.
Right, Andor.
Take four men and search beyond the village.
Quickly. Quickly!
This way.
No, this way.
What?
This way.
Neeva! Neeva!
Well?
It got away, with Leela's help.
Devil-spawned witch.
They will be found. Andor's organising search parties.
It's too late. Tell him the attack must not be delayed.
What happened? You must be able to remember.
Well, of course I can remember. I'm trying to. Perhaps I was on another part of the planet.
There is no other part. Only beyond the Wall.
Beyond the Wall. I wonder.
What?
Shush, shush, shush. I'm wondering. Back to the village.
We can't!
Why not?
We'll be torn to pieces!
Not if they don't catch us, we won't. Anyway, they'll be preparing for their battle.
That's what you said last time.
Well, you can't expect perfection, you know. Not even from me.
(silent) Oh, you.
The men refuse to attack while the Evil One is out there.
I have been thinking. We tell them it has been destroyed.
No! I will not lie to my people.
The Wall will be open for a very short time. We dare not delay. We must attack now, or you betray our god.
Has Xoanon commanded this?
He has.
Guard, sound the call.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The guard leaves.

Dialogue.Line: You had better be right, Neeva, because servant of Xoanon or not, if we fail, I will kill you.
Xoanon has promised us victory.
No. He has promised you. And you have promised us.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Where Leela cut through the wall fabric.

Dialogue.Line: (sotto) I must examine those relics.
(sotto) The village was dangerous enough, but the shrine of Xoanon?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor watches, unseen.

Dialogue.Line: Speak to me, Xoanon, that I may know your will. Speak, Xoanon. Speak.
Shaman Neeva! It's time to leave!
I'm coming.
Andor asks that you do not delay.
I said I'm coming!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Neeva puts his spacesuit back on its stand, puts on another coat made of old bits of spaceship and a helmet fashioned from a spacesuit glove.

Dialogue.Line: I like the hat. Very fetching.
That was the Hand of Xoanon.
That was an armoured space glove, or what was left of one.
The attack must begin at once.
Xoanon has spoken. We shall not fail.
It's all clear.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He goes to the tables of relics.

Dialogue.Line: Amazing. You know, I had a feeling, I had a feeling that Neeva was actually expecting to hear an answer to his prayer.
There wouldn't be much point in praying if he didn't.
I could quote you a few theologians who'd give you an argument on that. He was listening.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor picks up a blue tube and presses a button on the side.

Dialogue.Line: Hello? Intergalactic Operator? Hello? Over? Dead as a Dalek. There must be something.
Why did you talk to that tube?
I thought I recognised it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor goes to the stand and taps the spacesuit helmet, then turns away.

Dialogue.Line: Neeva.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela drops to her knees, hands over her ears.

Dialogue.Line: Neeva!
Poor old Neeva. Hotline to god. Psst. Don't be afraid. It's only a machine for sending voices over long distances. That may be Xoanon speaking, but it's not God. Gods don't use transceivers.
Are you certain?
Aren't you?
Yes.
That's better.
Neeva. Neeva.
I'm sorry, Neeva isn't here at the moment. Could I take a message? Over.
At last we are here. At last. At last. Us.
Us?
You. Me. Us. We. At last I shall be free of us.
Who are you?
Don't I know?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor backs away.

Dialogue.Line: Leela, I have a feeling. Something nasty. Something I did. It seems like it.
What are you talking about?
Who did that voice remind you of?
You. It was your voice. How could that be?
More to the point, who could that be? I must take a look at the Wall.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As Andor leads his warriors, both men and women, through the forest, Leela and the Doctor stand in front of a shimmering something.

Dialogue.Line: It's a time barrier.
I don't understand.

The principle's really quite simple. You just move everything forward a couple of seconds inside it. You get a barrier that's impervious to all energy. A true void. I've seen it done as a parlour trick, but never on this scale.
Isn't there any way to get through it?
Not unless whoever set it up deliberately bridged it.
So that means Andor and the others
Are walking into a trap, yes.
Isn't there any way we can warn them?
It's too late. Anyway, they wouldn't listen.
Calib might. Let's try.
Attack!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The warriors start firing crossbow bolts before moving forward.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, attack!
Attack!
Attack! Attack!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But Calib hangs back.

Dialogue.Line: Xoanon, protect your warriors and strengthen their arms, that they may free you.
Attack!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A beam of light shines down on Neeva, giving him pain and forcing him to his knees. Other warriors fall too.

Dialogue.Line: Someone's coming.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela hides, but the Doctor stands in the open.

Dialogue.Line: Hello, Calib. I was just thinking about you.
So Neeva and Andor were lying.
I wouldn't be surprised.
Where's Leela?
Behind you.
Ah.
How was the battle?
Just as the old ones remembered the last time. The Wall closed up.
A massacre?
More than half the men were killed, and we never even saw the Tesh.
You seem unhurt.
There's no virtue in dying, Leela.
That rather depends on what you do to avoid it.
Leela, put the knife away. I'm sure he's a reasonable man.
Thank you. So what do you want of me?
We need someone's help.
Leela seems to think it might be yours.
The tribe is in desperate danger, Calib. The Doctor can help. He's the only one who can. But we must convince the others he's not the Evil One.
Having first of all, of course, convinced you.
I don't think you're the Evil One, and never have. I don't believe in ghosts.
I'm impressed. Perhaps Leela's right about you.
But if I'm to help, I need to know everything.
There isn't much time. You see, Leela and I found an impenetrable barrier

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Calib stabs a Janis thorn into Leela's hand and draws his knife.

Dialogue.Line: Janis thorn. Something you haven't thought of. Now stay where you are.
I thought you were too easily convinced.
I meant it. You're certainly not the Evil One, but the others think you are. Neeva said you'd been destroyed. You're just the evidence I need to break him.
She underestimated your ambition.
It's for the good of the tribe.
Of course. This too.
She would have opposed me. I said stay where you are!
You need me alive, remember?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tomas bursts in.

Dialogue.Line: Calib, you held back! You cost us the attack!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Calib is distracted. The Doctor kicks his leg out from under him and grabs Leela's crossbow.

Dialogue.Line: Come in. Who are you?
Tomas. Leela! What have you done to her?
He poisoned her with a Janis thorn. Up!
You've broken my leg.
I'll break your nose if you don't get up. Now pick her up, both of you.
It takes skill to use one of those.
What, at this range? No, all it needs is a flick of the wrist. Pick her up.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tomas and Calib lift the rigid Leela between them.

Dialogue.Line: And move.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They put her on the acceleration couch.

Dialogue.Line: Gently.
Now what are you going to do?
Tomas, you don't want her to die, do you?
No, of course not.
Then cover him. I need time to work.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tomas takes the crossbow from the Doctor, who turns to the relics.

Dialogue.Line: This is a bioanalyser, rattlesnake. I can identify the poison and programme the medikit to make an antitoxin.
Back against the wall.
I'm going to give the alarm.
Back against the wall!
Oh, don't be a fool, Tomas!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes the thorn from Leela's hand and puts a sample into the analyser. He notes the results and goes to another piece of equipment.

Dialogue.Line: What do you suppose he's doing, Tomas? You don't really think that's going to help Leela, poking around in Neeva's relics?
Shut up, rattlesnake. I'm trying to save time. Leela hasn't got much left.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The analyser produces a printout which the Doctor puts into the medikit.

Dialogue.Line: I think she's dead.
Got it!
He's gone!
Watch the door.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor presses the mini-hypo into Leela's palm. After a few moments, she blinks, then moves her head.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor?
Are you all right?
The Janis thorn. There's no cure.
Yes, there is. Just a matter of finding one.
Do you know the answer to everything?
Yes. Well, no, no. Answers are easy. It's asking the right questions that is hard.
They're coming.
Can you move?
I think so. My arm hurts a bit.
Tomas, take her out of the back way.
I'm staying with you.
You're going with Tomas. I'll meet you both later. Go.
Good evening, gentlemen. You know, I never thought you'd get here. Good heavens, look at that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They all look behind them, and the Doctor sits on the 'throne'.

Dialogue.Line: Now then, down to business. I'm beginning to think you don't like me. Ah, Neeva. Is it really you? They told me you were dead. Or was it the other way round?
So Calib was right. Both of you in league with the Evil One.
You blind, blind fool, Andor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela, the Doctor and Tomas have their hands tied behind them, and Andor is back on his 'throne'.

Dialogue.Line: You lied to us!
Come on, Neeva, tell them your mistake.
Silence! Be silent!
You said it was destroyed!

Dialogue.Line: He knows where we are.
Sensory links everywhere? That's impossible.

He'd be able to measure every change in temperature, vibration, pressure. LEELA [on screen]: You did say he was the most powerful computer ever built. DOCTOR [on screen]: Yes, and very charming he is too when he wants to be. Marvellous host. I remember once at one of his dinner parties
Doctor, he just tried to kill you! We've got very little time, he knows exactly where we are
So? We know exactly where he is. Fair does. You wouldn't want an unfair advantage, would you?
Yes.
(sotto) I thought you'd say that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: With the sounds of weapons in the background, Tomas runs up to Calib.

Dialogue.Line: They're retreating, going further up the tower.
Then they're beaten.
No. No, it was too easy.
It's not finished yet.
If we let them get away now they'll regroup. We attack!
Calib, this has got to be a trap.
I am the leader, Tomas, and I say attack.
Calib! Will you listen
I've listened enough! We attack. Come! Attack! Attack!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Calib leads warriors off.

Dialogue.Line: That man's going to kill us all.
Unfinished, for the Tesh stand between the sons of the tribe of Sevateem and Xoanon.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor brings life to another monitor screen and a console.

Dialogue.Line: Ah.
Ah, that's pretty.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An alarm sounds on another console.

Dialogue.Line: Now we can see, too.
What are they all for?
They watch and control various parts of the ship, make sure everything's working properly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: One screen is counting down through 439.

Dialogue.Line: What's this one for?
Atomic generators.
Oh. Why is it flashing?
Well, I'll explain it all

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He turns around suddenly as her words reach his brain.

Dialogue.Line: Flashing? He's put the atomic generators on overload. He got desperate sooner than I thought.
What does that mean?
Well, it means I've got about twenty four and a half minutes to build a reverse memory transfer system and wipe my personality print from its brain.
And if you can't do it?
If I can't do it, the atomic generators will explode, taking Xoanon, us and half the planet with them. Effective, but crude.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A larger version of the usual weapon is being set up on a tripod.

Dialogue.Line: Check that the sights are exactly aligned, Sarton. There must be no mistake.
Gentek, are the projectors set so that the savages will be forced to come this way?
Yes, Captain.

Good. All that remains is to project a blank wall in front of the disrupters. As soon as the savages are all in the corridor, we will demolish them before they even know where the beams are coming from.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jabel's speech slows, and he puts a hand to his forehead.

Dialogue.Line: Is something wrong, Captain?
You feel
Something
Power. Xoanon. Communion. At last.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jabel and Gentek walk away.
The Doctor is putting the finishing touches to his contraption with a pair of pliers. Xoanon's face appears on the computer room door. Leela puts her hand to her head.

Dialogue.Line: Destroy and be free. Destroy and be free.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Calib peers round a corner at an unmanned disrupter.

Dialogue.Line: There's no one in sight.
There's only one way to find out, isn't there.
Now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They jump round the corner.

Dialogue.Line: Come on.
Gently, Calib, gently.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There's no one round the next corner either.

Dialogue.Line: This must be a trap set by the Tesh. Then where are they, and why leave the weapon unattended?
I don't know. It doesn't make sense.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Then Tomas puts his hand to his head. So does Calib.

Dialogue.Line: Destroy and be free. Destroy and be free.
Destroy and be free. Destroy and be free.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Sevateem leave, then Neeva arrives. He takes the disrupter off its stand.

Dialogue.Line: I hear you, Xoanon. I hear you.
Destroy and be free! Destroy and be free!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela draws her knife.

Dialogue.Line: (silent) Destroy and be free. Destroy and be free. Destroy and be free.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She raises the knife high and stabs down, but the Doctor moves to the side and she plunges the blade into a box of electrical circuits, giving her a shock. The Doctor puts her on a chair and checks her pulse.

Dialogue.Line: You'll be all right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Time is running out on the overload countdown. The Doctor finds himself surrounded by Tesh, and Sevateem with knives.

Dialogue.Line: Xoanon, you'll destroy yourself as well as us!
Destroy! Free! Destroy!
Free!
Xoanon!
Destroy! Free!
Xoanon!
Destroy! Free!
Die, Xoanon!
Destroy! Free!
Die!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An energy beam comes from the mouth on the door, and Neeva vanishes.

Dialogue.Line: Neeva.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tesh and Sevateem are frozen. The Doctor ducks out from under their raised weapons and puts on the headset he has made just as the overload status goes to full red. The men turn.

Dialogue.Line: Now, Xoanon.
No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The men make a grab for the Doctor, but he plugs himself into the computer and they fall back. The image of Xoanon recedes into the distance with a scream. The atomic generator overload reverses itself and everyone wakes from their possession. Later, the Doctor is lying on the floor with a silver pillow under his head. Leela is about to take a bite from a piece of chocolate then changes her mind, waves it under his nose and puts it on the floor beside him. The Doctor wakes. Everyone else has gone.

Dialogue.Line: Hello.
I was beginning to think you'd never come round.
Ow. I wish I hadn't.
I thought it safer not to move you.
Yes. How long have I been out?
Two days.
Two days. Two days? I haven't got time to be lying around here for two days!
You should have thought of that before. What happened?
Don't you listen?
I don't remember a thing.
No, I don't suppose you do. I removed, I hope I removed half of Xoanon's dual personality. How is he?
Silent.
What?
There hasn't been a murmur from him since I found you unconscious. And Jabel's people don't dare go near the Sacred Heart. Well, that's what they call it.
And what do you call it?
The main computer complex.
That's better.
I've told them all I can, but they won't listen to me. They say I'm ignorant. We have a guarded truce at the moment.
Give me a chocolate. I think I'll go and see Xoanon.
Can I, can I come inside this time?
Perhaps. Perhaps.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The disruptor is still lying where Neeva dropped it.

Dialogue.Line: Ah, so that's why Xoanon lost his hold on Tomas and the rest. I wonder who it was?
They say Neeva was trying to kill him, and now he can't be found.
Well, if he was psychotic he'd be impossible to control. Perhaps Xoanon will tell us. Anyone at home?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The door opens. The voice that answers is number 2, not Tom Baker's.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor. I've been waiting for you. Yes, come in please.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Leela enter. The lighting is golden and the walls are blank. They talk to the globe.

Dialogue.Line: How do you feel?
I am whole. And you?
Oh, I'm fine now, thanks. Can't complain.
Good, good. I'm glad.
Why did you do all that?
Could you be more specific?
Keep us ignorant and afraid. Make us hate one another.
I created a world in my own image. I made your people act out my torment. I made my madness reality.
But you told yourself you were breeding a race of superhumans.
Independence, strength, boldness and courage in one tribe. Self- denial, control, telepathy in the other.
Hostility and conflict to speed up the process until you were ready to select the best of both.
It's horrible.
Yes, it is horrible. Isn't it horrible?
But it's over now. We are all free, thanks to you, Doctor.
Oh, well, it was the least I could do in the circumstances. After all, I did start the trouble in the first place.
Yours was a mistake anyone could have made.
I don't think anyone could have made it.
(laughs) Sit down, please.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A settee appears, with a wind-up gramophone on a stand beside it. They sit. Leela sits cross-legged. The Doctor takes a jelly baby from a silver cigarette case and eats it.

Dialogue.Line: Well now, isn't this nice.
Tell me, Doctor. Where do you think I started to go wrong?
My people will not agree to such degenerate plans.
But they are necessary, Jabel.
Necessary for our survival.
I do not agree.
Well, we'll ask the Doctor's opinion when he comes.
Is that wise? Would Xoanon wish it?
That is an important consideration, Captain.
This discussion is getting us nowhere.
Would one expect any more from savages?
Hold your tongue, you scrawny
Calib, control yourself.
Gentlemen, gentlemen, gentlemen. Democracy at work, I see.
What did he say, Doctor?
He said he's extremely sorry about all the trouble that he's caused, that he has great power and knowledge and he puts it all at your disposal.
Should we trust him?
He offers you this as a token of his good faith.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A large round red button.

Dialogue.Line: Press it, and he'll cease to exist.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Neither Jabel nor Tomas will take it.

Dialogue.Line: Another of your miracles?
Well, there's one way to find out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Calib backs away from the button too.

Dialogue.Line: No? Little Gentek? Good.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The button vanishes.

Dialogue.Line: You've got to trust someone sometime.
But we must still choose a leader.
Ah. But that's not my problem.
There is no choice to be made. I am the leader of the Sevateem.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor quietly backs out of the room.

Dialogue.Line: My people would never accept the leadership of a mindless savage.
That's an insult!
I am a mindless savage, Jabel, and I have talked with Xoanon.
And that makes Leela the obvious candidate.
Me? But I don't want to be leader. I'm far too unreasonable, aren't I, Doctor? Doctor?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor unlocks the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor?
Leela. What are you doing here?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She is carrying a gun.

Dialogue.Line: I thought you might need an escort. The creatures are still out here.
You don't need that, Leela. The phantoms were merely projections of Xoanon's disturbed subconscious. He's better now.
I suppose you're always right about everything.
Invariably. Invariably. Goodbye.
Take me with you.
Why?
What? Well. You like me, don't you?
Well, yes, I suppose I do like you. But then, I like lots of people but I can't go carting them around the universe with me. Goodbye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Leela runs past the Doctor into the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Come out of there. Out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He enters the Tardis.

Dialogue.Line: Come out! Don't touch that! Don't touch

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis dematerialises.
